intro: Chamaeangis vagans, commonly known as the wandering chamaeangis, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, aromatic scent, while its flowers range in color from white to pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Chamaeangis vagans is considered a species of conservation concern.
